repo.description: Nvim Node.js client and plugin host
repo.name: node-client

comment_data.body:
I'm planning to make findNvim "async", and then this might fail. That's an example of why spies/mocks are brittle.

To test actual behavior, we could specify real paths in the `customPaths`, paths that we know exist but aren't valid: e.g. `['README.md', ...]` and then assert the results, which should contain an `invalid` object. 

As a bonus that also allows us to better test the behavior of `invalid`. And it avoids the need to mock internal details like `existsSync`.

```suggestion
   * These paths will be checked before searching `dirs`.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -35,6 +35,23 @@ export type FindNvimOptions = {
    * (Optional) Stop searching after found a valid match
    */
   readonly firstMatch?: boolean;
+  /**
+   * (Optional) Additional specific file paths to check for Nvim executables.
+   * These paths will be checked before searching in directories.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
   * These directories will be searched after checking `paths`
   * but before searching `$PATH` and other default locations.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -35,6 +35,23 @@ export type FindNvimOptions = {
    * (Optional) Stop searching after found a valid match
    */
   readonly firstMatch?: boolean;
+  /**
+   * (Optional) Additional specific file paths to check for Nvim executables.
+   * These paths will be checked before searching in directories.
+   * Useful for allowing users to specify exact Nvim executable locations.
+   *
+   * Example: ['/usr/local/bin/nvim', '/opt/homebrew/bin/nvim']
+   */
+  readonly paths?: string[];
+  /**
+   * (Optional) Additional directories to search for Nvim executables.
+   * These directories will be searched after checking specific paths
+   * but before searching in default system locations.

comment_data.body: should we normalize opts.paths/dirs to avoid duplicates in the Set?
Good point, I think we should.

+  /**

+   * These directories will be searched after checking specific paths

@@ -35,6 +35,23 @@ export type FindNvimOptions = {
    * (Optional) Stop searching after found a valid match
    */
   readonly firstMatch?: boolean;
+  /**
+   * (Optional) Additional specific file paths to check for Nvim executables.
+   * These paths will be checked before searching in directories.

comment_data.body: i would except this to be "3" because we passed 3 invalid paths. why is it 1?

oh, this was for the case where we were searching directories. in that case, we still want to ignore "not found" because we are manually building the path by appending `nvim`.

but for the case where `paths` is explicitly passed, I think it makes sense to add any/all of those paths to `invalid` if they are not found.
